item.title: DejaQ
item.description: Author: Adrian Bledea-Georgescu Mainteners: Mihai Oprea, Sandu Samyr David Contributors: Radu Viorel Cosnita, Diana Maftei, Daniel Coman, Silviu Badea Abstract DejaQ is a distributed messaging queue built for high-throughput persistent messages that have an arbitrary or time-based order. It allows a point-to-point scheduled message-oriented async communication for loosely coupled systems in time and spaceÂ (reference). Its main use case is to allow consumers to process messages that are produced out of order (the messages are consumed in a different order than they were produced).
